usefulItems: bowl, serving bowls, large baking tray, freezer-proof container, pastry brush, oven
title: Asparagus Risotto, Sun-dried Tomato Tear and Share Rolls, Berry Foam

ingredients.content: Sun-dried Tomato Tear and Share Rolls
90 g sun-dried tomatoes in oil, drained
30 g olive oil, plus extra for greasing
1 tsp fine sea salt, to taste
500 g mixed berries, frozen, to taste
1 egg white, from medium or large egg
1 egg yolk, from medium or large egg
60 g Parmesan cheese, cut in pieces (2 cm)

preparations.content: Preparation
Preparation Before Demo
Cut off asparagus tips and set aside. Cut each asparagus stalk into 3 pieces and set aside.
Sun-dried Tomato Tear and Share Rolls
Preheat oven to 50°C and grease a large baking tray (see tip).
Place water, sugar and yeast in mixing bowl then mix <b>20 sec/speed 2<b>.

Add flour, sun-dried tomatoes, oil and salt then knead <b>2 min/<b>. Tip out and divide dough into 12 equal-sized pieces, then roll each into a ball. Arrange side by side in rows (6 x 2) on prepared tray so rolls are just touching. Place in preheated oven and leave to prove for 20 minutes (50°C, quick rise).  Meanwhile, self-wash mixing bowl by covering blade with water and a drop of washing up liquid. Set for <b>1 min/60°C/speed 6<b>. Discard water, rinse and wipe dry then make berry foam.
Berry Foam
Place sugar in mixing bowl and grind <b>15 sec/speed 10<b>.
Add frozen berries, lime juice and egg white then, while stirring with spatula through hole in mixing bowl lid, blend <b>40 sec/speed 5<b>.
<b>Insert butterfly whisk<b> and whisk <b>3 min/speed 3.5<b>. Transfer to serving bowls and enjoy, freezing any leftovers in a freezer-proof container. Rinse mixing bowl, then make risotto.
Baking
Brush rolls with reserved egg yolk then increase oven temperature to 180°C and bake for 18-20 minutes (180°C) or until rolls sound hollow when tapped underneath. Meanwhile, continue with recipe.
Asparagus Risotto
Place Parmesan in mixing bowl and grate <b>10 sec/speed 10<b>. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Place asparagus stalk pieces, shallots and oil in mixing bowl then chop <b>5 sec/speed 5<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula then sauté <b>3 min/120°C/speed 1<b>.
Add wine then risotto rice and, without measuring cup, cook <b>2 min/120°C//speed 1<b>. Scrape base of mixing bowl with spatula to loosen rice.

Add hot stock, salt and pepper. Place Varoma dish into position and weigh in peas. Cover then cook <b>12-15 min/100°C//speed 1<b> until rice is cooked al dente (with a bite) - the risotto should be slightly soupy at this stage.
Set Varoma aside. Add reserved asparagus tips, reserved Parmesan and butter then stir in with spatula. Adjust seasoning if desired then replace Varoma and leave to rest for 2 minutes.
Serve with peas on the side accompanied by the tear and share rolls.

hintsAndTricks: If the oven does not have a 50°C setting, preheat oven to 100°C then turn off before placing loaves in warm oven to prove.
